Well, Pakistan is the only place where polio really is significantly expanding.
One reason for it is the exodus of about a million people from the mountainous tribal belt bordering Afghanistan.
That happened in the summer when the Pakistani military rolled in there on a big offensive to crush the Taliban and their allies, who, for years, have been using the area as a sanctuary.
The upside of it was that it meant that health workers could get access to lots of children as they came down from the mountains and administer vaccines to them.
